qas.question: How many people demonstrated on October 1?

answers.text: in front of Lviv's Druzhba Stadium

qas.question: What was happening in the stadium at the time?
Prior to the October 20 synod, when was the last one held in Lviv?

context: On October 1, 1989, a peaceful demonstration of <a0_0>10,000 to 15,000<a0_0/> people was violently dispersed by the <a1_0>militia<a1_0/> <a2_0>in front of Lviv's Druzhba Stadium<a2_0/>, where a <a3_0>concert<a3_0/> celebrating the Soviet "reunification" of Ukrainian lands was being held. On October 10, Ivano-Frankivsk was the site of a pre-election protest attended by 30,000 people. On October 15, several thousand people gathered in Chervonohrad, Chernivtsi, Rivne, and Zhytomyr; 500 in Dnipropetrovsk; and 30,000 in Lviv to protest the election law. On October 20, faithful and clergy of the Ukrainian Autocephalous Orthodox Church participated in a synod in Lviv, the first since its forced liquidation in the <a4_0>1930s<a4_0/>.
